title: ‘Meaningful work’: Volunteers clean Ho Chi Minh City’s fetid canals by hand
description: Vietnam's largest city is plagued by rubbish but eager young volunteers are doing their bit to clean up the environment.

title: Ecuador presidential candidates make final push to woo voters
description: Ahead of vote on Sunday, presidential hopefuls are promising improved security in country struggling with surging crime.

title: US escalates trade dispute with Mexico over genetically modified corn
description: Washington requests settlement panel under North American trade deal in push against Mexican curbs on corn imports.

title: Hurricane Hilary to dump heavy rain on Mexico, southwest US
description: The hurricane is expected to strengthen rapidly as it travels through the Pacific Ocean, meteorologists warn.

title: HRW, UN raise alarm over rape accusations against Sudan’s RSF
description: New York-based Human Rights Watch says it documented 78 victims of rape between April 24 and June 26.

title: What does Libya’s political future hold?
description: Dozens of people killed in fighting between rival armed groups in Tripoli.

title: Thousands flee as ‘unprecedented’ fires hit Canada’s Northwest Territories
description: Officials say 20,000 residents of Yellowknife are leaving via land and air, but northern city not in 'immediate danger'.

title: After early World Cup exit, US women’s team coach Andonovski steps down
description: The US team lost to Sweden in the World Cup's round of 16, a disappointing departure for a tournament favourite.

title: Iran FM in Saudi Arabia, says relations ‘on the right track’
description: Saudi Arabia's and Iran's foreign ministers meet as both counties seek to overcome past hostility and boost cooperation.

title: UK’s Sunak, Saudi crown prince to meet ‘at the earliest opportunity’
description: Mohammed bin Salman has not visited Britain since March 2018 before the killing of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

title: Ukraine: Ground Zero
description: People and Power investigates the toxic legacy of war on Ukraine’s fragile environment.

title: Five key issues to look out for at first US Republican debate
description: Candidates will look to narrow former President Donald Trump's lead in race for 2024 Republican presidential nomination.

title: Messi, Haaland make shortlist for UEFA’s best player award
description: The three-man shortlist also includes Kevin De Bruyne; Pep Guardiola is favourite for the men's coaching award.

title: ‘He said he’d surrender’: A family in shock after Israeli raid kills son
description: Mustafa al-Kastoni, a commander of Al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigades, was killed after Israeli forces besieged his house.

title: Pakistan election body to draw new boundaries as polls likely to be delayed
description: Pakistan's Election Commission says new constituencies would be finalised by December 14, according to state TV.

title: Ten killed after private jet crashes on a highway in Malaysia
description: Plane was heading from Langkawi island to Selangor's Sultan Abdul Aziz Shah Airport near Kuala Lumpur.

title: Two dozen Nigerian troops die in air crash and evacuation mission gone awry
description: A helicopter has crashed in the Nigerian state of Niger, killing more than two dozen officers, military authorities say.

title: Haitian gang leader warns potential foreign force against any abuses
description: Jimmy 'Barbecue' Cherizier says Haitians will rise up against international force if human rights abuses committed.

title: Hawaii’s governor promises to prevent ‘land grabs’ after Maui wildfires
description: As US state assesses wide destruction, residents on Maui say they fear being pushed out in favour of wealthy visitors.

title: Middle East Roundup: The Rabaa massacre remembered
description: Ten years since the Rabaa massacre in Egypt, dozens killed in Libya- here’s the Middle East this week.

title: After backlash, NATO chief says only Ukraine can decide on talks to end war
description: Stoltenberg's chief of staff suggested earlier that Kyiv could give up land to Russia in return for NATO membership.

title: Spain Socialists win first parliamentary battle, securing speaker role
description: Francina Armengol's election augurs well for Pedro Sanchez's efforts to return as Spain's prime minister.

title: ‘Captured the nation’: Australia-England match breaks broadcast records
description: The Women's World Cup semifinal racked up 11.5 million viewers, Australian broadcaster Seven said.

title: The New Greatness Case: Russian teenagers on trial
description: A Russian filmmaker follows the court case of a teenage girl who is accused of conspiring to overthrow the government.

title: ‘New milestone’: Leaders of US, Japan and South Korea to meet at Camp David
description: Amid Japan-South Korea detente, summit presents chance to shore up trilateral alliance to counter China and North Korea.

title: Rohingya refugees fled Myanmar only to ‘live in fear’ in India
description: In Nuh, the only Muslim-majority district in Haryana, Rohingya refugees live in fear of violence and detention.

title: Most of West Africa ready to join standby force in Niger: ECOWAS
description: ECOWAS commissioner says all member states will join the force except those under military rule and Cape Verde.

title: Does artificial intelligence pose a risk to humans?
description: Jaan Tallinn, one of the co-founders of hit software like Skype and Kazaa, says AI poses an existential risk to humans.

title: Liberia has suffered 20 years of ‘negative peace’. It’s time for change
description: The root causes of Liberia's wars have remained unaddressed; the first step to changing that is rebuilding trust.

title: Pakistan arrests 146 as it launches probe into church attacks
description: Some 6,000 police and troops deployed to control mob violence as Christian community reels in shock over attacks.

title: Amid Quran burnings, Sweden raises ‘terror’ threat
description: Sweden has faced international condemnation after a string of desecrations of the holy book by anti-Islam activists.

title: Indian moon lander module splits from propulsion section in key step
description: The lander module of the Chandrayaan-3 has successfully separated ahead of a planned moon landing slated for August 23.

title: Ukraine’s Kuleba promises to ‘free Africa from Russia’s grip’
description: Foreign minister says Kyiv intends to conduct a diplomatic 'counteroffensive' against Russia's efforts to woo Africa.

title: US approves landmark missile defence deal between Israel and Germany
description: The $3.5bn deal will provide US-Israeli developed Arrow 3s, designed to shoot down targets above Earth's atmosphere.

title: Heavy rain causes flight cancellations, floods in Germany
description: Parts of Germany see streets deluged and trees toppled as storm leads to dozens of flight cancellations in Frankfurt.

title: Armenia, Azerbaijan clash over plight of people in Nagorno-Karabakh
description: At a UN Security Council meeting, Yerevan accuses Baku of starving the region dominated by ethnic Armenians.

title: South African play revives complex stories of women in apartheid era
description: Isidlamlilo is a one-woman play on untold angles of black-on-black violence in South African townships during apartheid.

title: Inside Thailand’s Child Sex Tourism Trade
description: 101 East investigates Thailand’s sex tourism trade and how vulnerable children are exploited.

title: Why did clashes break out in Libya’s Tripoli?
description: Fighting between the 444 Brigade and the Special Deterrence Force has raged this week after months of relative peace.

title: ‘We need power’: Zimbabweans hope for end to blackouts as election nears
description: For many businesses in Zimbabwe where the economy is in free fall, electricity outages have been the norm for years.

title: Taliban’s ties with Pakistan fraying amid mounting security concerns
description: Two years since the Taliban took over Afghanistan, ties between the neighbours deteriorate amid rise in armed attacks.

title: French mistakes helped create Africa’s coup belt
description: Across the Sahel, public anger against France has helped putschists gain legitimacy and Russia expand its influence.

title: Ukraine air force says no use of US-built F-16 fighter jets this year
description: Air force spokesperson Yuriy Ihnat says F-16 warplanes will not be part of Ukraine's defence during 'autumn and winter'.

title: Pakistan’s Christian community reels from violent attacks
description: Churches and homes belonging to Christians attacked by Muslim mob in Punjab province following claims of blasphemy.

title: Spain battles ‘out of control’ wildfire on Tenerife
description: Last week, a heatwave in the Canary Islands left many areas bone dry, heightening the risk of wildfires.

title: North Korea could take military action around key summit: South Korea
description: Actions could include ICBM and spy satellite launch amid signs of activity at key launch sites.

title: Will Modi’s Uniform Civil Code kill Indian ‘secularism’?
description: The Indian PM says common laws will help women, but many fear the proposal is an election weapon to target minorities.

title: Singapore arrests 10, seizes $737m in assets in money laundering raids
description: Police say the group is suspected of involvement in organised crime activities 'including scams and online gambling'.

title: Russian spacecraft reaches lunar orbit in preparation for moon landing
description: Russia’s Luna-25 space probe enters lunar orbit in first Russian mission to the moon in almost 50 years.

title: Lithuania closes two border crossings with Belarus amid growing tensions
description: Lithuania temporarily shuts two of six checkpoints located on shared 680km border with Belarus over security concerns.

title: China urged to tackle online racism targeting Black people
description: Human Rights Watch says racist tropes 'common' across Chinese social media, and that platforms and government must act.

title: Georgia prosecutor seeks March trial for Trump in election meddling case
description: Proposed date would have trial start a day before 'Super Tuesday', when over a dozen states hold Republican primaries.

title: Huge wildfire forces evacuation of Canada’s Northwest Territories capital
description: Residents of Northwest Territories capital, Yellowknife, told to evacuate city by noon on Friday as wildfire approaches.

title: Manchester City score victory over Sevilla to win first UEFA Super Cup
description: Manchester City beat Sevilla in a 5-4 penalty shootout following game that ended in a 1-1 draw after regulation time.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 540
description: As the war enters its 540th day, these are the main developments.

title: Ukraine probes Kherson defences, advances in east and south
description: Ukrainian reconnaissance land on left bank of the Dnipro, probing Russian defences and suggesting a new front may open.

title: Nicaragua seizes Catholic university accused of being ‘centre of terrorism’
description: Critics have accused the government of President Daniel Ortega of continuing its attacks on education and religion.
